msbt.message: When one is dedicated to creating impeccable interior designone gains a certain clarity about things.

Once upon a time, I fell in love with a handsome—if rather outlandish— table and bought it on the spot. But when I got that table home, I realized it was so brash it clashed with all my other furniture. I tried to make it work—and failed. But while I had to let that handsome table go, I learned a valuable lesson. No matter how handsome a table is, if it doesn't complement your style, it shouldn't come home with you!

You see, once upon a time, I owned a chair that was both solidly built and quite comfortable. Alas, it didn't have a shred of playfulness, and was anything but bold. So, I grew bored of it. I had no choice but to let it go. Still, that chair taught me something important "Comfortable" is not enough for me, my dear. I need somethingMORE.
It may not be obvious at first glance, but this ensemble of mine—it was meticulously assembled.

You see, clothing is key to making a good impression. I take great care to be up on the latest fashions. In fact, I was wearing a new sweater recently and snagged it on a tree. Of course, now it has a big hole in it. But holes are VERY fashion forward so I shall just wear it as it is.

You see, I try to create a look that is flawlessly fashionable, and yet seems as if I put no effort into it at all. I call this style "unintentionally fabulous."But I confess, it's not easy putting so much effort into making my outfits look so effortless.

See, whether my look is "elegant and sophisticated" or "hip and trendy," the clothes I wear declare who I am. That's why I'm experimenting with several new stylesso I can experiment with several new MEs! Oooh! I know! I should get a ghost writer and publish my experiments in a scholarly fashion journal!

When things are weighing upon you, it's best to have a bit of alone time, don't you think? Yes, well, not long ago I took a much-needed solo vacation.I relaxed in some hot springs and I spent an entire day at a spa all on my own. And wouldn't you know itall of my worries vanished! Just like that! You really should try it sometime.

The other day, on a whim, I just up and went bowling all by myself.Would you believe I got a bunch of strikes and turkeys and whatnot? I was quite impressed with myself. But getting a strike without having anyone to celebrate it with It felt hollow somehow.

When you're feeling down, it's important to have some "me time," I say! Which is why I recently reserved a small karaoke room for me and me alone. I spent an hour singing my heart out at the top of my lungs! I tell you, it was incredibly freeing! Or at least it was until I realized the door was open a bit, and everyone could hear me! What a show I must have given them, !

I've been hearing ALL about this new hot trend called "On Your Own."It's like this You go out and do something all by yourself. I hear it makes you feel incredibly free! Well, I'd like to give it a try. In factI think I'll try going to a movie all by myself. I know! You should come with me! It will be loads of fun, !
I went to my class reunion not long ago. And, to be honest, I was nervous about going.

But it was lovely! I caught up with friends I hadn't seen in forever and heard all about their lives. One of my old friends was always joking around in school. And now he's a professional clown! He said he just followed the school counselor's advice: Do what you love, and love what you do!

Would it be awkward to see everyone after so long, I wondered? But it was funnynot much had changed! One of my old friends was always doodling in her notebook. And now she's a comic-book artist! She said she just followed the school counselor's advice: Do what you love, and love what you do!

Would I have anything in common with my old friends, I wondered? But I worried for nothing! One of my friends who used to dress as stylishly as I did in school— she's now a fashion designer! She said she just followed the school counselor's advice: Do what you love, and love what you do!
Ahh, I remember way back when I used to be an actress, .It's been such a long time since I set foot onstageSometimes I turn on a light in my house and suddenly I miss the spotlight

Hmm. I was just thinking back on the days when I was a model.I thought walking the runway was my purpose, my path in lifeBut if life's path was just a straight line with only an occasional turn, it would be so boring, !

I remember long agowhen I was the bluesiest of jazz singers.Reaching folks with my voice That was how I found my place in the world. But now I have a place, here on . And I'm done singing sad songs, !
Now, be honest, What do you think of all this selfie business?I know, I know. Selfies are ALL the rage

Still, it's not my cup of tea. I mean, really! Standing there, taking a photo of yourself! How gauche! Of course, , if YOU were to offer to take my photo, why, I'd have no choice but to say yes! Just make sure it looks as if I took it myself, darling. I'm sure you understand.

I've even given them a try. Really, I have, .But holding a NookPhone above my face, trying to get a perfect angle My arms are like rubber afterwards! I say, why work up a sweat when you can pay a professional photographer to do all the heavy lifting for you?

It's justevery time I try, I can never decide which angle looks best.From above and to the left? From above and to the right? From above and in the middle? Honestly, my dear, they all look so good, it's impossible to decide.
